conclusion: Determine possible scenarios of particle's motion based on v-t graph.
Graph is symmetric about the dashed line.
Symmetry suggests particle's motion is mirrored over time.
Graph shows velocity over time; area under curve represents displacement.
Graph indicates change in direction as velocity goes positive, zero, negative, then positive.
Particle must change direction twice to pass through a position three times.
Scenario 1: Particle moves positive, stops, moves negative, stops, moves positive.
Scenario 2: Particle moves positive, reverses, reverses again to original direction.
Symmetry ensures motion is consistent with scenarios, allowing multiple passes through same position.
Conclusion: Particle moves forward, reverses, then moves forward again, consistent with graph symmetry.
